data:
Unstable Patient 
- Febrile - oral or temporal temperature greater than or equal to 38.5 DegC or axilla temperature greater than or equal to 38 DegC
- Neutropenic - ANC less than 0.5
- Signs of Septic Shock (reduced level of conciousness, reduced blood pressure, reduced perfusion, increased heart rate) or based on clinical judgment
B.C Children's Hospital Fever and Neutropenia Guidelines
Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the powerplan
q5min heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure, temperature
q15min heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure, temperature
q1h heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure, temperature
q2h heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure , temperature
q4h heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure, temperature
If patient has Central Venous Catheter, access all lumens / ports and draw bloodwork
Age 9-12 months, Texture, Minced / Finger Food

sodium chloride 0.9% IV bolus:  
1) Repeat in 20 mL/kg increments up to 60 mL/kg   
2) If no response after bolus #2 of sodium chloride 0.9%, consider initiation of inotropes  
3) If 60 mL/kg of crystalloid fluid is given, then mandatory critical care consult and consider starting dopamine infusion on ward
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 5 minute, drug form:bag
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 15 minute, drug form:bag
20 mL/kg, IV, once, administer over: 30 minute, drug form:bag
PED ONCS Low Dose DOPamine Infusion (Module)
10 mg/kg, PO q4h interval, drug form: oral liquid
12.5 mg/kg, PO, q4h interval, drug form: oral liquid
12.5 mg/kg, PO, q4h interval, drug form: tab
10 mg/kg, PO q4h, PRN: fever,drug form: oral liquid
12.5 mg/kg, PO, q4h, PRN, fever,drug form: oral liquid
12.5 mg/kg, PO, q4h, PRN: fever, drug form: tab
Commence antibiotics as per Fever and Neutropenia Guidelines immediately after bloodwork
Consider dosage adjustments for renal impairment
Do not delay antimicrobial administration if bloodwork delayed
Commence antibiotics as per Fever and Neutropenia Guidelines immediately after bloodwork.  Do not delay antimicrobial administration if bloodwork delayed
20 mg/kg, IV, q8h interval, drug form: inj
PED/NEO TM Fibrinogen Replacement Transfusion (Cryopercipitate/Fibrinogen Concentrate) (Module)
PED/NEO PED TM Red Blood Cell (RBC) Transfusion (Module)
If gentamicin or vancomycin to be administered longer than 72 hours or if unstable renal function, place orders for therapeutic drug monitoring
